data.title: Honour Roll, Week 9: Metchie, Patterson, Ticats' O
data.meta_description: Royce Metchie, Shea Patterson and the Hamilton Tiger-Cats’ offensive line are at the head of the class for Week 9 in the CFL Honour Roll powered by Pro Football Focus (PFF).
data.text:
TORONTO — Royce Metchie, Shea Patterson and the Hamilton Tiger-Cats’ offensive line are at the head of the class for Week 9 in the Canadian Football League (CFL) Honour Roll powered by Pro Football Focus (PFF).

PFF utilizes extensive review of game footage to provide additional context for every action on the field. Highly-trained PFF staff breakdown every game, player and play to provide over 200 unique data points, which are used to compile Player Grades – a numerical representation up-to-100 of performance at their specific position. For more information on PFF, Player Grades, the Grading Scale and more, please visit pff.com/grades.

RELATED

» Sign up and play CFL Fantasy

» Get your tickets for 2024 games now

» Player and Team Grades Powered by PFF

Each week, the highest individual Player Grades on offence and defence, as well as the highest graded offensive line, will be recognized in the CFL Honour Roll. The best individual performers by Player Grade from each of ten position groups, including the newly added Returner, will form the All-Week team. Offensive and defensive players must play a minimum of 25 snaps to be eligible and special teams players must play 10. Kickers, punters and returners do not have eligibility requirements. Ties will be broken by the number of snaps played.

CFL HONOUR ROLL – WEEK 9: OFFENCE

QB | Shea Patterson | Saskatchewan Roughriders | EDM 42 – SSK 31

PFF Player Grade: 85.2

22-of-38 passing (58 per cent) for first 300+ yard game (306)

Career-high two touchdown passes

Four rushes for 30 yards and one touchdown

90.5 efficiency rating

Second Honour Roll All-week selection (Week 7)

CFL HONOUR ROLL – WEEK 9: DEFENCE

DB | Royce Metchie | Toronto Argonauts | TOR 23 – CGY 27

PFF Player Grade: 92.7

62 total defensive snaps

Nine defensive tackles to tie a career-high

First interception of the season and one forced fumble

91.6 Grade on 40 coverage snaps

CFL HONOUR ROLL – WEEK 9: OFFENSIVE LINE

Hamilton Tiger-Cats | MTL 33 – HAM 16

PFF unit grade: 73.0

Top-3 performers

Brendan Bordner | 71.8

Jordan Murray | 71.7

Coulter Woodmansey | 69.8

CFL HONOUR ROLL: ALL-WEEK 9

​(POS | Name | Team | Grade)

QB | Shea Patterson | Saskatchewan | 85.2

RB | Brady Oliveira | Winnipeg Blue | 83.2

REC | Marken Michel | Calgary | 75.6

OL | Shane Richards | Edmonton | 76.1

DL | Willie Jefferson | Winnipeg | 88.1

LB | Adam Bighill | Winnipeg | 76.2

DB | Royce Metchie | Toronto | 92.7

ST | Mario Alford | Saskatchewan | 90.6
